original: Zetterberg, John August Albin, ci-viUngenjör, Göteborg, f. 27/5/84 i Tyresö, Sthlms 1., av disp. Sven August Z. o. Anna Christina Andersdotter. G. 12 m. Carin Steiner. Barn: Sven Gustav f. 13, ing., ASEA, Gbg, Sten Gustav 15, d. 22, Stig Carl 19, civ:ing., ASEA, Västerås, Anna Gunvor Elisabeth 26. — Mog:ex. i Sthlm 04, KTH (E) 04-06 o. 08-09. Provrumsing. v. Nya Fören. Elektr. A-B i Ludvika 07-09, montageing. där 09-11, chef f. Bodens El. A-B o. Sikfors Kraft A-B 11-13, chef f. Nya Fören. El. A-B fil. i Malmö 13-16, chefsassist. v. ASEA fil. i Sundsvall 16-20, chef f. dess fil. i Umeå 20-25, i Gbg sed. 25. Ordf. i styr. f. El. entrepr :fören. Gbgsavd. o. El. propagandafören. i Gbg, v. ordf. i styr. f. El. arb :giv :fören. Gbgsavd., rev. i off. stift. m. m. Medl. av div. ordens-sällsk. Res. t. Finl., Norge, Danm., Tyskl, Engl. o. Frankr. PatrM m. m.
translated: Zetterberg, John August Albin, civil engineering student, Gothenburg, born on May 27, 1884 in Tyresö, Stockholm County, son of supervisor Sven August Z. and Anna Christina Andersdotter. Married on 12th to Carin Steiner. Children: Sven Gustav, born in 1913, engineer at ASEA in Gothenburg; Sten Gustav, born in 1915, deceased in 1922; Stig Carl, born in 1919, civil engineer at ASEA in Västerås; Anna Gunvor Elisabeth, born in 1926. Divorced in Stockholm in 1904. Attended Royal Institute of Technology (Electrical Engineering) in Stockholm from 1904 to 1906 and from 1908 to 1909. Tested as a probationary engineer at Nya Fören. Elektr. A-B in Ludvika from 1907 to 1909, worked as an assembler there from 1909 to 1911, became the manager of Bodens El. A-B and Sikfors Kraft A-B from 1911 to 1913, manager of Nya Fören. El. A-B branch in Malmö from 1913 to 1916, assistant manager at ASEA branch in Sundsvall from 1916 to 1920, manager of its branch in Umeå from 1920 to 1925, and in Gothenburg since 1925. Chairman of the board for Electrical Contractors Association's Gothenburg division and Electrical Propaganda Association in Gothenburg, vice chairman of the board for Employers' Association for Electrical Workers' Gothenburg division, board member of various charitable foundations, etc. Member of various fraternal societies. Traveled to Finland, Norway, Denmark, Germany, England, and France. Military service, etc.
